original: @ga_@#/_/rdo rje bye mdzad kyi sgrub thabs/
analyzed: @ga_@#/_/rdo rje bye mdzad kyi sgrub thabs/

original: /_/rgya gar skad du/_badzra hum ka ra sa d+ha nam/_bod skad du/
analyzed: /_/rgya gar skad du/_badzra hum ka ra sa d+ha nam/_bod skad du/
translated: In Tibetan: rdo rje hūṃ mdzad kyi sgrub thabs

original: rdo rje hum mdzad kyi sgrub thabs/_bcom ldan 'das rdo rje hum mdzad la phyag🔽'tshhal lo/_/sngon du gsungs pa'i cho gas nam mkha'i khams su ram yig las
analyzed: rdo rje hum mdzad kyi sgrub thabs/_bcom ldan 'das rdo rje hum mdzad la phyag 'tshhal lo/_/sngon du gsungs pa'i cho gas nam mkha'i khams su ram yig las
translated: Homage to the Blessed Vajrahūṃkāra.🔽With the previously described ritual, in the realm of space, from the syllable raṃ arises a sun,🔽upon which is the blazing syllable hūṃ,

original: skyes pa'i nyi ma la hum yig 'bar zhing 'bar ba la bskal pa tha ma'i me lta bu
analyzed: skyes pa'i nyi ma la hum yig 'bar zhing 'bar ba la bskal pa tha ma'i me lta bu
translated: like the fire at the end of the eon,

original: shin tu 'bar ba'i mchog tu kha dog gnag pa 'od zer chen po'o/_/de las
analyzed: shin tu 'bar ba'i mchog tu kha dog gnag pa 'od zer chen po'o/_/de las
translated: extremely blazing, supreme, dark-colored, with great light rays.🔽From that, the great wrathful one arises, devouring the three realms, with two hands, forming the mudrā of holding a vajra and a bell.

original: skyes pa'i drag po chen po khams gsum za bar mdzad pa/_phyag gnyis rdo rje dang dril bu rab tu sbyor ba'i phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o/_/g.yon brkyang gi zhabs
analyzed: skyes pa'i drag po chen po khams gsum za bar mdzad pa/_phyag gnyis rdo rje dang dril bu rab tu sbyor ba'i phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o/_/g.yon brkyang gi zhabs

original: kyis de bzhin du 'jigs byed mnan cing 'jigs par byed pa/_snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang /_mgo bo rnams su om ahhum zhes pa'i yi ge gsum dbang bskur
analyzed: kyis de bzhin du 'jigs byed mnan cing 'jigs par byed pa/_snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang /_mgo bo rnams su om ahhum zhes pa'i yi ge gsum dbang bskur
translated: at the heart, throat, and head, the three syllables oṃ, āḥ, and hūṃ confer empowerment.

original: ba'i cho gas thugs rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o/_/sngags ni o hu~m hu~m phat swa
analyzed: ba'i cho gas thugs rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o/_/sngags ni o hu~m hu~m phat swa
translated: With the mudra of mind, one should bind. The mantra is oṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svā

original: ha/_rdo rje hu~m mdzad kyi sgrub thabs rdzogs so//_//🔽rje hum mdzad kyi sgrub thabs/
analyzed: ha/_rdo rje hu~m mdzad kyi sgrub thabs rdzogs so//_//🔽rje hum mdzad kyi sgrub thabs/
translated: hā. The sādhana of Vajrahūṃkāra is complete.🔽The Sādhana of Lord Hūṃkāra
